Detailed Description

CKey is the baseclass for all key used by backends. The base class for all key objects.

CKey does only contain the functions used by all backends (only few functions, e.g.

See also:
getData()). The classes derived from this baseclass should be handled manually.

Author(s):
The BibleTime team
Version:
$Id

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CKey::CKey ( ) [inline]

The constructor of this CKey class.

In derived classes it should initialize the members.

CKey::~CKey ( ) [inline, virtual]

The destructor of CKey, In derived classes this function should delete the memory allocated by this object.

Member Function Documentation

void CKey::getData ( ) [pure virtual]

This function gets the data for the current key (e.g.

current verse, current map etc.) and stores the data in the member m_data. m_data has to be managed manually, since it has no base type (use dynamic_cast).

Reimplemented in CSwordLDKey, and CSwordVerseKey.
